Sibeleho buchwa esindu SILALA sia okhoyela omanye khuli ebirusi bia korona
eng: There's only ONE thing ﻿you need to understand about how a coronavirus

lts: Wasinjila sinaho ninaye. Sinaho sia ofulenje fubili silakhingilila amame okhutuukha wa oli.
eng: Keep your distance.﻿2m to 0.5m will keep you safe from large droplets.

lts: Kho niiba mbo olengela omundu wulolekha ni alakhololanga/ alasimulanga/ naho omulwale onyala:
eng: So if you see someone who is visibly coughing/sneezing/sick you can choose to:

lts: Omuhelesie emasiki okhukhinga emunwa nende amolu. Anyala wakhololelamo naho wasimulilamo mani siakhingilila buli omundu wuli ahambi okhunyoola ebirusi.
eng: Give them a mask.﻿They can cough or sneeze in it and protects everyone else nearby

lts: Aundi sali omulwale ta, alekhinganga buchwa.
eng: Maybe she's not sick, just protecting herself

lts: Abandu balala bahambisibwa yilali sibechesianga mbo abalwale ta, nabuchwa banyala bahambia abandi obulwale.
eng: People who are infected can show no symptoms, but are still﻿infectious

lts: Khandi bubeele obulayi okhulekha okhutubaana nende abandu mu ebituma, sikila somanya wina wunyala okhuba omulwale ta.
eng: And in general, it's a good idea to avoid crowds, because you don't know who might be sick.

lts: Yakhaba elwanyi wa emasiki ya okhukhinga omunwa na amolu.
eng: & even on the outside of your face mask

lts: Olupao lwa khu yingasi ya ekorofa
Kakhaba kario, ofuse fundi amare ka omundu omulwale kanyala karoonya khu ofundu fundi khuli…
eng: However, sometimes a sick person's saliva can get on other things…

lts: Olatiila khu ofundu funo mani wichukhane otiile amoni wuwo,
eng: And if you do touch any of these things by accident, and then touch your face,

lts: Kho okhusinga ofundu funo nende esabuni naho amachi nende esikelo sia amalwa niyo yinjila yonyene ya okhurusiakho ebirusi bino.
eng: and the only effective way to get rid of them is to wash them off with soap, bleach, or alcohol.

lts: Eburusi binyala biekhala khu ofundu khu ofuse ofurambi
eng: Viruses can last for quite a few hours on objects,

lts: Niko kakila nibuli obulayi okhulonda amakhuwa ka
eng: Which is why it is also good to follow these
wash with soap up to here

lts: Okhehabasia hamoni wuwo ta. (Naho hamoni wa omundu wundi ta.) Niiba mbo okhoya okhole kano, singa emikhono kikio nende esabuni obulayi bwene mbele.
eng: Do not touch your face. (Or anyone else's face.) If you have to, wash your hands with soap thoroughly first.

lts: Ofuse fwolana okwimba “Mwana wa mbeli” khabili
eng: Enough time to sing “Happy Birthday” twice
wash the back of your hands

lts: Nikaba bari otililekho, okhahenda ta. Singa buchwa amakhono kaako nende esabuni.
eng: If you did, don't worry. Just wash your hands with soap after.

lts: Nikanyalikha okhatiila olubeka lwa elwanyi lwa emasiki ta.
eng: Also, don't touch the outside of the mask if you can.

lts: Ebirusi bikhulunduanga olubeka lwa mukari lwa emasiki oleboha oluhono.
eng: *Bacteria grows on the insides of your mask if you wear them too long

lts: Sukuna emasiki ya okhukhinga emunwa yilanyira. Okheboha emasiki okhubira yinyinga ndala ta.
eng: Throw away masks once they feel gross. Don't wear them for more than a day!

lts: Buli omundu abe nende etaulo yiye
Mukhasanga ofwakhulia khusililikho silala ta,naho ofukombe naho chitaulo ta.
eng: Do not share food, utensils, cups, towels.

lts: Sonyala okhutiila hamoni wuwo nende yikhumbo ta ata wakhakhaka.
eng: You can't touch your face with your elbow even if you tried

lts: Niwikula naho okhwikala olwiki rumikhila yikhumbo naho amabeka nikanyalikha, okharumikhila omukhono ta.
eng: Open & close doors with your elbows or shoulders instead of hands, if possible.

lts: Nende niwakharula elwanyi mu abandu abanyinji
eng: and after being out in the public

lts: Singa emikhono kikio buli khase nende esabuni….
eng: Always wash your hands with soap…

lts: Read the articles for more tips!
eng: Read the articles for more tips!
